p: Multidrug resistance is one of the major challenges for the chemotherapeutic treatment of cancer. Noticeably, cotreatment of DMC ( 38) with anticancer drugs, such as 5-fluorouracil (5-FU), Taxol, and doxorubicin against drug-resistant cancer cells resulted in enhanced drug sensitivity in cancer cells. Specifically, Qian et al. [ 15] investigated the reversal effect of DMC against doxorubicin-resistant KB-A1 cells. In the presence of DMC, the IC 50 value of doxorubicin against KB-A1 cells dropped from 13.9 ± 0.7 to 3.6 ± 0.7 μg/mL. In the xenograft model, DMC (20 and 40 mg/kg) potentiated the anticancer effects of doxorubicin, which was evidenced by 47.0 and 70.0% reduction of the tumor weight, respectively. The underlying mechanism was through the attenuation of MDR1 gene expression and the reduction of intracellular P-glycoprotein [ 15].
